document_name_accent: dot quy thieu mau cuc bo.json
document_title: What is an ischemic stroke? Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
To accurately diagnose ischemic stroke, patients need to perform a number of related paraclinical tests, typically:
Computerized tomography (CT Scanner), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI); Blood tests: To look for signs of infection or heart damage, check blood clotting ability, blood sugar levels, liver and kidney function, etc.; Electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG): To check the health of the heart and heart abnormalities, if any; Electroencephalogram (EEG): This test helps doctors rule out the risk of epilepsy or related problems.
Some paraclinical tests that help diagnose ischemic stroke include: CT Scanner, MRI scan, blood tests, electrocardiogram and electroencephalogram.
subsection_title: dot quy thieu mau cuc bo.json. How to diagnose ischemic stroke
